intro: Sphaerostephanos scandens, commonly known as the climbing starflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its trailing or climbing growth habit. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a hairy texture. Sphaerostephanos scandens is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
